availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Brewster Irvin (Mercer County, KY, Farmer)

body.p: Mercer County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Lucretia Starnes Irvin in Mercer County, Kentucky, in 1829. Father of James F. Irvin, Sarah Irvin, Decy A. Irvin, Samuel W. Irvin, and Benjamin B. Irvin. Farmer in Mercer County in 1860. Owned seven enslaved persons in Mercer County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, District 2, p. 646.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, District 2, p. 43B.
"James B. Irvin (1802-1889)," Find A Grave, Memorial #58178488, accessed October 9, 2019, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/58178488.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Mercer County Marriages, Film #000191851, p. 51.
